column5: i was wondering if anyone knows of a good place to buy props....used or new....for my yamaha kicker......  i hit some rocks....arrrrrrrrrrrgggg    thxs  pete

G'morning pete..........Pete here....lol This past week I picked up a spare prop.....17 x 14 Cost me $70.....here in Quinte... 'Mobile Marine Services'.........613.922.8741...ask for Don.. .he's a retired marine mech working outta his garage. ....also p/u 70' of 5/8" braided dock line off him @ $1/ft.  I had gone to BayMarine in Belleville and Pete'sPropShop on the Rez in Desoronto and both quotes for my spare prop were similar in at $250....
Just make sure if you buy reconditioned that it's balanced... makes a big difference. My slogan is "if it's not balanced it's not fixed!"
He just rebuilt mine and it is as good as new. He may be able to fix yours.
Theres a place in Orrilla.Sorry the name escapes me. Check the 411 on the net.

Busted prop?! How'd you manage that?  I've called around a few places - cheapest I've found is these guys... Ask for Louie when you call. He's got a bunch of Yamaha props used, some new - but not in the box - so they're really inexpensive. He figures $50-$90 range to replace it... If you had the peice, he could fix it right proper. Wanna go back and look?  City Wide Welding Inc 1867 Drew Road, Mississauga, ON L5S 1J5 Telephone : 905-677-0316

thxs guys for all the help.......i have phoned round and managed to find some decent pricing....j and j is probably the cheapest....but all the way out in fort erie.......i think ill just get one from yamaha for a 100.....with the price of gas doesnt really make sense to drive all over...   but thxs again to everyone for their input.....   oh water bird....did ya get my rods back!!!!!  and next time bring the sandwiches...that way i wont brake a prop.....lol....  cheers pete

try Simcoe prop, 905 722 7767 . it is near pefferlaw, beaverton area and on your way to Balsam lake or other Kawarthas lake .  Speak to Doug, tell him joshua refered you to him. Explain the problem and ask for a quote on the phone.  You might be able to drop it off and pick it up at the same time on your way back after fishing one fo the Kawarthas lake. It is his house so you can always pick it up after 8:00pm.  He lives up north away  from the city, his rate got to be good as he works at home and laid back county.  check ebay if you are willing to wait.  Joshua
